alert.note: Alert for Clay; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 3:14PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Talladega and central Clay Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 314 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waldo, or near Talladega, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Talladega, Waldo, Chandler Springs and Gunthertown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
